guide_details: Developed by S. Blakeslee, <font="Fredoka-Bold SDF">CRAAP</font> method is used for evaluating online sources!

content.title: About Currency
content.details: Is the information posted just recently?

examples.example: What is the copyright, publication, or posting date?

content.title: About Relevance
content.details: Is the information applicable to the situation?

examples.example: For what audience or level is the information written?
Why would you or would not quote/reference the information from this source?

content.title: About Authority
content.details: Is the information made by knowledgeable and trusted authors or publishers?

examples.example: Who is the author, creator, or publisher of the source or what organization is responsible for the source?

content.title: About Accuracy
content.details: Is the information reliable and trustworthy in and of itself?

examples.example: What indications do you see that the information is or is not well researched or provides sufficient evidence?

content.title: About Purpose
content.details: Why does the  information exist in the first place?

examples.example: How might the intended audience affect the point of view, slant, or potential bias of the information?
How does this resource compare to others on the same topic?
